key_title: Key to the species of Alternanthera

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Amaranthaceae

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Amaranthaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Walsh, N.G. (1996). Amaranthaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Inflorescence pedunculate, terminal or axillary; plants glabrous, forming large dense mats, with stems to 10 m long, rooting at nodes; leaves mostly more than 30 mm long and 10 mm wide
Inflorescence sessile in axis; plants pubescent (at least when young), not exceeding 1 m in length; leaves mostly less than 30 mm long, if longer, not more than 10 mm wide
Leaves oblong to narrowly elliptic or obovate, less than 1 cm wide; tepals ± equal, not spine-tipped
Leaves broadly elliptic or obovate, mostly more than 1 cm wide; inner and outer tepals unequal, the longer, outer tepals spine-tipped
Perianth 2–3.5 mm long, acute; prostrate or scrambling herbs often rooting at lower nodes
Perianth 3–5 mm long, acuminate; taprooted herb with ± ascending branches
Leaves ± oblong to narrow-elliptic, mostly 30 mm long or more; internodes mostly more than 25 mm; trailing or weakly ascending herb of swamps and river margins
Leaves ovate to obovate, mostly under 25 mm long; internodes mostly less than 20 mm; prostrate herb of drier sites, often on heavy soils
